Community Initiatives

Datasets Licensing Project

Sub-categories: Licensing, Metadata &amp; Ontologies

Started: 2017

Founded by: Jisc, The University of Glasgow, and CREATe

Current URL: https://datasetlicencing.wordpress.com/

Goals: Provide licensing support and guidance for data creators and users (Jisc, CREATe, &amp; The University of Glasgow, 2017). Use insights gained from the Datasets Licensing Project to inform future efforts for the Jisc Research Data Shared Service (Jisc, 2018).

Status:

DCC’s How to License Research Data

Sub-categories: Informational Resource, Licensing, Metadata &amp; Ontologies

Started: 2014

Founded by: Digital Curation Centre

Current URL: http://www.dcc.ac.uk/resources/how-guides/license-research-data

Goals: Develop a guide for licensing research data, including information on why to license research data, licensing concepts, prepared licenses, bespoke licenses, standard licenses, multiple licensing, mechanisms for licensing data, and licensing-related information (Ball, 2014).

Status:

FAIRsharing.org

Sub-categories: Informational Resource, Metadata &amp; Ontologies

Started: 2009

Founded by: University of Oxford and the Oxford e-Research Centre

Current URL: https://fairsharing.org/

Goals: Provide a comprehensive information resource to guide researchers toward increasing data sharing and supporting reproducible research through providing recommendations, collections, and educational resources about data sharing policies, standards, and databases.

Status:

Research Data Alliance

Sub-categories: Rights, Licensing, Metadata &amp; Ontologies

Started: 2013

Founded by: European Commission, the US National Science Foundation (NSF), and the Australian Government’s Department of Innovation (The Research Data Alliance, 2017).

Current URL: https://www.rd-alliance.org/

Goals: Facilitate data re-use through the development of interest groups and working groups that collaborate to develop outputs such as policies, recommendations, standards, codes, and best practices (Research Data Alliance, 2017c).

Status:

The Federal Demonstration Partnership: Data Transfer and Use Agreement Pilot

Sub-categories: Informational Resource, licensing

Started: 2017

Founded by: The Federal Demonstration Partnership

Current URL: http://thefdp.org/default/committees/research-compliance/data-stewardship

Goals: The broad goal of the Federal Demonstration Partnership (FDP), a cooperative effort among 10 United States federal agencies and 154 institutional federal funding recipients, is to mitigate administrative loads related to research grants and contracts (The Federal Demonstration Partnership, 2018). As it relates to data stewardship, the FDP has conducted a Data Transfer and Use Agreement pilot towards the creation of data transfer and use agreement templates (The Federal Demonstration Partnership, 2018). These templates were developed to reduce the complex and time-consuming process of crafting individualized data transfer and use agreements for each research collaboration.

Status:

The (Re)usable Data Project

Sub-categories: Informational Resource, Licensing

Started: 2017

Founded by: National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (NCATS) Biomedical Data Translator and the Monarch Initiative (The Reusable Data Project, 2017).

Current URL: http://reusabledata.org/

Goals: To facilitate legal interoperability through conversation about accessibility, comprehension, clarify, and licensing decisions that affect data sharing within the scientific community. (The Reusable Data Project, 2017). Evaluate biological and biomedical data sources for their data reusability and redistribution potential.

Status:
